summary: A letter from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, transmitting Deutsche Bank's fifth production of documents in response to a July 11, 2019 grand jury subpoena. The production includes 'Know Your Customer' records and account statements for Jeffrey Epstein-affiliated accounts.

persons.name: Parvin D. Moyne
persons.context: Attorney from Akin Gump who co-signed the letter transmitting Deutsche Bank's document production to the U.S. Attorney's Office in response to a grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: James J. Benjamin, Jr.
persons.context: Attorney from Akin Gump who co-signed the letter transmitting Deutsche Bank's document production to the U.S. Attorney's Office in response to a grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose affiliated accounts are the subject of the grand jury subpoena and the produced 'Know Your Customer' records and account statements from Deutsche Bank.

connections.description: Co-signatories of the legal correspondence from Akin Gump, both representing Deutsche Bank in its response to the grand jury subpoena.
Moyne, as counsel for Deutsche Bank, is involved in producing financial records related to Epstein's accounts in response to a government subpoena.
Benjamin, as counsel for Deutsche Bank, is involved in producing financial records related to Epstein's accounts in response to a government subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Deutsche Bank
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued to Deutsche Bank, seeking documents related to Jeffrey Epstein-affiliated accounts.

events.title: Fifth Document Production to U.S. Attorney's Office
events.description: Deutsche Bank, through its counsel Akin Gump, submitted its fifth production of documents in response to the July 11 subpoena, including KYC records and account statements for Epstein.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, 1 Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Deutsche Bank was under active grand jury investigation in July/August 2019 regarding Jeffrey Epstein's financial activities.
The subpoena sought 'Know Your Customer' (KYC) records and account statements for Epstein-affiliated accounts, indicating scrutiny of the bank's due diligence and Epstein's financial transactions.
This document represents the fifth in a series of rolling productions from Deutsche Bank to the government, showing an ongoing, extensive document collection process.
The correspondence emphasizes the confidential nature of the production under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e), related to grand jury secrecy.
The law firm Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP represented Deutsche Bank in this grand jury matter.
